Ingredients.1: 2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast meat - cut into chunks

Ingredients.3: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup

Ingredients.9: 1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chiles, drained

Ingredients.10: 1 (1.25 ounce) package mild taco seasoning mix

Ingredients.17: 1 (6 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained

Directions.1: Place chicken into a large pot and add water to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until chicken is no longer pink and the juices run clear, about 10 minutes.

Directions.2: Remove from the pot and let sit until cool enough to handle, 5 to 10 minutes. Shred chicken with two forks.

Directions.3: Combine sour cream, condensed soup, and chili powder in a saucepan. Bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally, then turn off the heat and cover to keep warm.

Directions.4: At the same time, melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add shredded chicken, water, 1/2 of the green onions, green chiles, and taco seasoning; simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in lime juice, onion powder, and garlic powder; simmer for 10 more minutes.

Directions.5: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Directions.6: Stir 1 cup soup mixture into the skillet with the chicken. Spread remaining soup mixture over the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.

Directions.7: Fill each tortilla with 1/5 of the chicken mixture and about 5 tablespoons Cheddar cheese. Roll tortillas around filling and place enchiladas, seam-side down, into the baking dish. Pour enchilada sauce over top and sprinkle with remaining Cheddar, remaining green onions, and olives.

Directions.8: Bake in the preheated oven until filling is heated through and cheese is melted and bubbling, about 25 minutes.
